job_title: Digital Content Executive in Maidenhead, England
pros: After working in multiple jobs in different sectors for most of my adult life, it has been fantastic to work at the CWGC. I am a history enthusiast, so being able to align what I do for a living with my interests has been amazing. From a work perspective, the team is extremely close and helpful. We are all on the same page and pulling in the same direction. Management and bosses within the Digital team are first class, putting our needs as workers first, ensuring we have the tools to succeed, helping when necessary, and providing us with personal growth and training opportunities. Can't recommend it enough.
cons: Pay is lower than what I would be getting in the private sector but we're doing a public-sector role and important commemoration work, so it's not a bad trade off in my view.

pros: Good commission standard to work in

pros:
As an experienced IT professional, I have now been with the commission for 4 months and feel an extreme sense of pride coming into work each day and making a difference for a great cause. It’s extremely satisfying to work in an organisation where everyone has the same drive and passion to honour the war dead. I have found all staff to be extremely friendly and welcoming, there doesn’t appear to be that competitiveness that you often come across in the corporate world, everyone works as a team sharing a common goal. The management are extremely supportive and openly encourage growth of internal employees. 

The initial two-week HR induction process is very well planned and provides a great opportunity to obtain a good background of the wider organisation and extend your internal network.
cons: Very limited car parking but Maidenhead has good train links and the office is walking distance from the station. CWGC, also do a good job of tracking parking availability on a weekly basis to reallocate internal car spaces if staff who have a permanent car parking space are on leave or travelling.

pros: The ultimate sacrifice made in these 2 wars, the respect and honour placed against keeping their memory alive is amazing.
cons: HO has an unnaturally high turnover of staff and it is all for the same reasons. CWGC is carrying some top heavy dead wood. CWGC needs to be more modern in its progression and 100% embrace legislation on best practice over how staff are treated and recognised. So unfortunately you are very much metered on what success you can deliver from the 21st century. The exact reasons you are told at interview on why you are being brought in then become the reaon to shut you down and stop this progression. There is NO parking at this job, you are put on a 7-10 year wait list, which is embarrassing to have to identify. Maidenhead as a town is also predominantly full of permit parking only roads so if you can walk there or have a good public transport link you will need it.

job_title: Public Engagement Coordinator in City of Westminster, England
pros: Reasonably well paid, interesting subject matter, passionate colleagues, engaged (nerdy) clientele.
cons: Abusive and toxic HR culture. I've never felt so afraid just turning up to work. Crazy abuse of loyal staff - because there is no other organisation like this, some think it is fair to mistreat others as a result. Deeply worrying.

job_title: Gardener Caretaker Gc1 in London, England
pros: Amazing job what it represents looking after the fallen
cons: Poor management old school boy culture

pros:
I was run ragged at my last job working 24/7 and I came to the commission unsure what to expect. 

I found a team of people who believe in what the organisation does and a passion to make a difference for the sake of our ancenters and their friends. Its nice to come to an orgnisation where we all work for one common cause and to be part of a team / family where there are over 1.7 million, if you include the war dead ;-)

The commission invests allot in its staff, we had a wellness week, so Yoga, time management, singing event, lavender and gifts each day of the week to everyone desk and a new addition at the top of our building of a beautiful garden and seating area with plenty of cushions :-) I have never experienced this before !!!

So well done to CWGC because the care is certainly here if you choose to find it and take part :-)
cons: Like every place it has its challenges, it can be hard work at time with deadlines and we try to establish new processes with a growing team which can be a little confusing but we try :-)

pros: A nice objective. Interesting history. Good outdoor locations.
